required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association Between Vitamin D and the Risk of Uterine Fibroids
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Vitamin D and the Risk of Uterine Fibroids

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this randomised clinical trial study is to evaluate whether supplementation with vitamin D could reduce the risk of uterine fibroids in reproductive stage women.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 1160 hypovitaminosis D patients (12 ng/ml ≤ serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D3 < 20 ng/ml) without uterine fibroids will be randomly assigned in a ratio of 1:1 to two groups: intervention group and control group. The intervention group will receive 1600 IU/d of vitamin D3; the control group will receive regular follow-up. Patients will be followed up at the same time points for 24 months. The outcome measure is the incidence of uterine fibroids in different groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of uterine fibroids in different groups
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of uterine fibroids in different groups after two years treatment

secondary_outcome.description: The level of serum calcium > 2.5 mmol/L
Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate transaminase (AST) more than 3 times of the normal upper limit, or total bilirubin (TBIL) more than 2 times of the normal upper limit
Creatinine levels≥1.4 mg/dL (123μmol/L) or creatinine clearance ≤ 50 mL/min

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of uterine fibroids in different groups
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of uterine fibroids in different groups after one year treatment

arm_group.description: Patients in this group would take Vitamin D3 400 UNT Oral Capsule.
Patients in this group would take nothing.

intervention.description: 50,000 IU of vitamin D once a week for 8 weeks, 1500-2000 IU/day.

facility.name: The Second Affiliated Hospital and Yuying Children's Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
